title-group.article-title: THE INTRODUCTION OF "ARABIC" NUMERALS IN EUROPEAN ACCOUNTING

abstract.p: The general adoption of "Arabic" numerals by European bookkeepers occurred at least five hundred years after their introduction to the scholarly world. The early availability yet late adoption of this numeration is shown to be due to several factors, not least to interplay between the culture and cultural conservatism of clerks and the educational and intellectual changes of the early Italian Renaissance.
